item.description:
In electromagnetism, opposites not only attract, but if they get too close to each other they get stuck together on each other.

 

Is it that simple in human relationships?   Of course not!

 

So come join us for a discussion of the human heart.  Can introverts and extroverts make good couples? How do the wallflower and the party animal make it work?  Can liberals and conservatives cross party lines in the bedroom?  Or is a relationship between two extroverts the mix that seldom works?

 

Is a strongly spiritual guy dating a highly skeptical gal a formula for a match made in hell?  Should atheists and agnostics seek the same?

 

What lessons have you learned in making relationships work with an opposite?    What aspects in a partner that are different do you seek out?  What personality traits do you find important to have in common?

 

Do same sex couples run into the same sort of challenges, or perhaps less?

 

Come bring your thoughts and experiences to our discussion.

 

After the discussion, we'll head up the street to Orleans for some adult beverages and socializing.

 

[event date subject to change]
item.how_to_find_us: Look for us at the large table in back...
item.name: Do opposites attract?
